FuncDef:
The vsm on-board-mode enable command enables the NAT/IPsec function for the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S on a specified device.
The undo vsm on-board-mode enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S does not support NAT/IPsec function.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-Ss, not VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S service boards, are installed on a device, you cannot configure NAT on such boards before enabling NAT on them.
If a device hosts both the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S and VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S, the NAT/IPsec function takes effect only for the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S by default. To enable the NAT/IPsec function for the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S, run the vsm on-board-mode enable command.
Precautions
After the vsm on-board-mode enable command is run, NAT/IPsec cannot be configured for the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S service boards but can be configured for the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S. NAT/IPsec can continue to be configured for the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S service boards only after the undo vsm on-board-mode enable command is run.
The VSUI-160-E service board supports the NAT function but does not support the IPsec function.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
